Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial Peptides And Methods Of Making And Using Same
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention provides a new methodology combining MD simulations and database-guided high-throughput screening to rationally design pore forming membrane-active peptides. The present inventive methodology is able to allow tuning of a range of structural and functional properties such as pore size and selectively targeting membranes with specific lipid compositions. The present inventive methods will ultimately allow de novo design of membrane-active peptides for a wide range of biomedical applications, including for example, antimicrobial agents.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus cereus (MIC=50 µg/ml), Lactococcus lactis (MIC=25 µg/ml), Listeria innocua (MIC=100 µg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=100 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: The aurein antibiotics show more activity towards gram-positive than gram-negative pathogens. Probably acts by disturbing membrane functions with its amphipathic structure. Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.

Literature.Title: The antibiotic and anticancer active aurein peptides from the Australian Bell Frogs Litoria aurea and Litoria raniformis the solution structure of aurein 1.2.
Literature.Author: Rozek T, Wegener KL, Bowie JH, Olver IN, Carver JA, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.
